subject: Re: Package Protection
msgSnippet: ... access ... was ... Hey.. Thanks a lot.. I appreciate the help. I am not the developer of the xmlInfo.. I am just the tester of the entire application and
messageBody:
> boyfrnd007 wrote:
> > I have written a class.. suppose in
> > wei.cot.rem.ppgs.xmlinfo.java
> > and then i have a test package..
> > wei.cot.rem.ppgs.test.xmlInfoTest.java..
> > xmlInfo does not have public class. It is defined like
> > class xmlInfo{
> > //
> > //
> > }.
> > When I try running the test, it gives me error that I cannot
access
> > the class. I think something is related to packge protection.. I
was
> > wondering if this problem could be solved too..
>
> Yes. Make the class public.


Hey..
Thanks a lot.. I appreciate the help. I am not the developer of the
xmlInfo.. I am just the tester of the entire application and the
developers have made that it in such a way that no one can access
it. So, I think the only way that can be tested is if i put my
testclass is the samepackage with xmlinfo.. Is that right?.. I
cannot make the class xmlInfo public. It is out of my reach..
Thanks,
Abhishek
